landed may 1st began march 3 clock afternoon directing course pocket compass n e gone 2 mile came foot hill built small hutts lay night excessive rain till 12 clock 2d day morning fair weather ascended hill found small indian path followed till found run much easterly doubting would carry u way climbd highest tree hill meanly furnished large tall tree ever saw length discovered house valley north side hill steep could descend side followed small path led u hill east side presently found several indian house first came foot hill none woman home could speak spanish gave u good calabash shell full corndrink house men home none spoke spanish yet made shift buy food house plantation afforded drest eat together sort provision common none live better others pay dearer thing worth day marched 6 mile evening husband woman came home told u broken spanish board guard ship fled two day three mile mouth river congo could go thence aboard guard ship half tydes time evening supped plentifully fowl pecary sort wild hog bought indian yam patatoes plantain served u bread whereof enough supper agreed one indian guide u day march country towards north side pain hatchet bargain bring u certain indian habitation could speak spanish hope better satisfied journey 3d day fair weather began stir betimes set betwixt 6 7 clock marching several old ruined plantation morning one men tired gave u slip 12 clock gone 8 mile arrived indian house lived bank river congo spake good spanish declared reason visit first seemed dubious entertaining discourse u gave impertinent answer question demanded told u knew way north side country could carry u cheapo santa maria knew spanish garrison one lying eastward u westward either least 20 mile way could get answer discourse angry tone plainly declared friend however forced make virtue necessity humour neither time place angry indian life lying hand great loss knowing course take tempted bead money hatchet macheats long knife nothing would work till one men took skycoloured petticoat bag put wife much pleased present immediately began chatter husband soon brought better humour could tell u knew way north side would gone u cut foot 2 day made uncapable serving u would take care want guide therefore hired indian brought u hither conduct u 2 day march another hatchet old man would stayed u day rained hard business required haste enemy lying near u told u could go house aboard guard ship tydes time 4th day since saw u marched 3 mile farther built hutts stayed night rained afternoon greatest part night 4th day began march betimes forenoon commonly fair much rain afternoon tho whether rained shined much one u verily believe crost river 30 time day indian path travel one part country another therefore guiding river marched day 12 mile built hutts lay sleep always kept two men watch otherwise slave might knockt u head slept rained violently afternoon part night much ado kindle fire evening hutts mean ordinary fire small could dry cloaths scarce warm self sort food belly made hard u confess hardship quite expelld thought enemy 4 day country began care get guide food spaniard seldom thought 5th day set morning betimes travelled 7 mile wild pathless wood 10 clock morning arrived young spanish indian house formerly lived bishop panama young indian brisk spoke good spanish received u kindly plantation afforded u store provision yam potato nothing flesh beside two fat monkey shot part whereof destributed company weak sickly others got egg refreshment indian still provided sick weak spanish indian company first took arm captain sawkins u ever since death perswaded live master house promised sister marriage assistant clearing plantation would consent part fear treachery promised release two three day certainly danger enemy stayed afternoon dryed cloaths ammunition cleared gun provided self march next morning chyrurgeon mr wafer came sad disaster drying powder careless fellow passed pipe lighted set fire powder blew scortchd knee reduced condition able march wherefore allowed slave carry thing u concernd accident lyable self every moment misfortune none look u indian plantation seated bank river congo fat soyl thus far might come canoa could perswaded 6th day set hired another guide first crost river congo canoa first landing west side river marched eastward 2 mile came another river forded several time though deep two men able keep company u came u able last time forded river deep tallest men stood deepest place handed sick weak short men mean got safe except two behind foreseeing necessity wading river frequently landmarch took care left ship provide self large joint bambo stopt end closing wax keep water preserved journal writing wet tho often forced swim river sat wait coming consort left behind half hour came river time high could get neither could help bid good comfort stay till river fall marched 2 mile farther side river built hutts gone day 6 mile scarce finished hutts river rose much higher overflowing bank obliged u remove higher ground next night came could build hutts lay straggling wood one tree another could find conveniency might indifferent comfortable weather fair greatest part night extraordinary hard rain much lightening terrible clap thunder hardship inconveniencies made u careless watch kept tho believe body sleep slave taking opportunity went away night one hid hole knew nothing design else fell asleep went away carried chyrurgeons gun money next morning 8th day went river side found much fallen guide would u ford deep current running swift could contrived swim could swim resolved help well could feizable able get thing length concluded send one man line hale thing first get men agreed one george gayny took end line made fast neck left end ashore one man stood line clear away gayny midst water line drawing chancd kink grow entangled stood clear away stopt line turned gayny back line hand threw river thinking might recover stream running swift man three hundred dollar back carried never seen u two men left behind day told u afterwards found lying dead creek eddy driven ashore money back meddled care work way wild unknown country put period contrivance fourth man lost landjourney two men left day come u till north sea yielded also lost frustrated getting river way lookt tree fell across river length found one cut reach clear passed side found small plantainwalk soon ransackt busie getting plantain guide gone le two hour came u brought old indian deliverd charge gave hatchet dismist entered self conduct new guide immediately led u away crost another river enterd large valley fattest land ever take notice tree thick largest saw travel saw great track made pecaries saw none marchd pleasant country till 3 clock afternoon 4 mile arrived old man countryhouse habitation hunting small plantainwalk yam potato took quarter day refreshed self food place afforded dryed cloaths ammunition place indian provided leave u thought self past danger perswaded stay last house came marry young man sister dismissd according promise ninth day old man conducted u towards habitation marched 5 mile valley ascended hill travelled 5 mile farther two three small hill came settlement half mile came plantation light path carried u indian habitation saw many wooden cross erected way created jealousie u spaniard therefore new primed gun provided self enemy coming town found none indian got together large house receive u old man little boy sent made u welcome mean new plantation corn eared patatoes yam plantain none brought old plantation none spoke good spanish two young men could speak little caused u take notice made present desired get u guide conduct u north side part way promised would reward told u must lye still next day thought self nearer north sea proposed go without guide rather stay whole day however men tired resolved stay behind mr wafer chirurgeon marched great pain ever since knee burned powder resolved stay tenth day got betimes resolving march indian opposed much could seeing could perswade u stay came u taken leave friend set therefore left chirurgeon two said marched away eastward marched 9 mile built hutts lay night evening killd quaum large bird big turkey wherewith treated guide brought provision u night last slave run away eleventh day marched 10 mile farther built hutts night went supperless bed twelfth morning crossed deep river passing tree marched 7 mile low swampy ground came side great deep river could get built hutts upon bank lay night upon barbecus frame stick raised 3 foot ground thirteenth day turned river overflowed bank 2 foot deep hutts guide went u telling u intent made u think returned home began repent haste coming last settlement food since came thence indeed got macawberries place wherewith satisfied self day though coursly fourteenth day morning betimes guide came u water fallen within bound carryd u tree stood bank river told u could fell tree cross might pas could pas therefore set two best axmen felld exactly cross river bow reached passed safe afterwards crossed another river three time much difficulty 3 clock afternoon came indian settlement met drove monkey kill 4 stayed night marched day 6 mile got plantain enough kind reception indian lived alone except one boy wait fifteenth day set kind indian boy went u canoa set u place could ford past great river returned back helped u least 2 mile marched afterwards 5 mile came large plantain walk took quarter night fed plentifully plantain ripe green fair weather day night think largest plantain walk biggest plantain ever saw house near gathered pleased guide order sixteenth day marched 3 mile came large settlement abode day man u wisht journey end foot blistered thigh stript wading many river way almost continually river pathless wood afternoon five u went seek game killd 3 monkey drest supper first began fair weather continued u till came north sea eighteenth day set 10 clock indian 5 canoas carried u league river landed kind indian went u carried burthen marched 3 mile farther built hutts travelled last settlement 6 mile nineteenth day guide lost way march 2 mile twentieth day 12 clock came cheapo river river crost hitherto run south sea cheapo last met run way old man came last settlement distributed burthen plantain amongst u taking leave returned home afterward forded river marched foot high mountain lay night day marched 9 mile 21st day indian returned back marched high mountain top went mile ridge steep side descended little came fine spring lay night gone day 9 mile weather still fair clear 22d day marched another high mountain keeping ridge 5 mile came north end great comfort saw sea descended parted self 3 company lay side river first met run north sea 23d day came several large plantain walk 10 clock came indian habitation far north sea got canoas carry u river conception sea side gone day 7 mile found great many indian mouth river promised guide march land panama way getting prisoner purpose absconding chagra portabell much good brought way panama especially armado lyeth portabell commander aboard captain wright came fleet mighty inquisitive prisoner know truth related concerning u soon knew come immediately came aboard captain tristian overjoyd see u captain coxon many others left u south sea 12 month since never heard became u since time enquired u lived far discovery made sea answered general question began particular examining u concerning passage country south sea related whole matter giving account fatigue march inconveniencies suffered rain disheartned quite design proposed several place party men got together might make voyage objection still hinderd proceeding privateer account town within 20 league sea coast trinidado la vera cruz able give near guess strength rich make business examine prisoner fall hand concerning country town city belong whether born long known many family whether spaniard whether major part coppercolourd mulatto mustesoes indian whether rich rich consist chiefest manufacture fortified many great gun number small arm whether itis possible come undescried many lookout centinels spaniard always keep lookout placed whether possible avoid lookout take river creek come near best landing innumerable question curiosity lead demand former discourse place prisoner compare one examine enquire capable guide conduct party men thither prisoner may taken may thence afterwards lay scheme prosecute whatever design take hand 7 8 day resolution taken yet consultation held every day french seemed forward go town english could would propose governour petitguavos privateer take commission recommended gentleman lately come france general expedition sent word captain tucker gentleman came possible make attempt town returnd english company french seemd approve french said never lookd general fit service hand length concluded go town name forgot lieth great way country tedious march would hence panama way lay carpenter river 60 league westward portabell greatest obstruction design want boat therefore concluded go fleet st andreas small uninhabited island lying near isle providence westward 13 deg 15 min north lat portabell n n w 70 league little way carpenter river besides island might build canoas plentifully stored large cedar purpose reason jamaicamen come hither frequently build sloop cedar fit building freecost beside wood jamaica well stored cedar chiefly among rocky mountain also st andreas grow stony ground largest ever knew heard body alone bark way brought u 5th day july captain knight mentioned last chapter came u cruising great way westward got nothing beside good ship last went southward high bay guiaquil took barklog pair barklogs although strength kingdom could afford merchant ship gone laden lying payta wait order captain knight men dare go payta better provided might taken made best way bay panama hope find u inriched spoil lima fleet coming king island advice prisoner ingaged fleet worsted since made way westward therefore came hither seek u presently consorted u set men work make canoas every ship company made helped course italian geometrical mile rate 60 degree progress ship make every day reckoned always noon noon course always made upon rumb direct line therefore 4th 5th column shew many mile ran south every day many west last main run voyage 17th april got pretty near latitude guam course lying along parallel northing southing consequently little according ship deviated direct course deviation thenceforward exprest n 5th column ship keeping straight west rumb 0 say northing southing 6th column shews lat every day r signifies dead reckoning running log ob shews lat observation 7th column shews wind weather would added 8th column shew variation needle small course neither make observation set mexican coast departure cape corrientes found 4 28 easterly observation made afterwards gone third voyage shewed near decreasing neither observe guam captain swan instrument cabbin seem much regard yet inclined think guam variation might either none even increasing westward conclude may 20th noon begin call 21st lat 12 50 n r run since noon 134 mile directly west continued course till 2 afternoon allow 10 mile west still finding parallel ran upon much southerly clapt wind sailed directly north till 5 afternoon time run 8 mile increased latitude many minute making 12 58 saw island guam bearing n n e distant u 8 league give latitude island 13 20 according account foregoing longitude 125 11 west cape corrientes coast mexico allowing 58 59 italian mile degree latitude common rate 60 mile degree equator computed corollary hence follow upon supposal truth general allowance seaman make 60 italian mile equinoctial degree south sea must greater breadth 25 degree commonly reckoned hydrographers make 100 le since found shall occasion say distance guam eastern part asia much common reckoning follows way necessary consequence hence 25 degree longitude abouts underreckond distance america east indie westward must reckoned breadth asia africk atlantick sea american continent together tract terraqueous globe must much shortened confirmation fact shall add aethiopick indian sea breadth must considerably le ti generally calculated true heard several able seaman conversed part ship sailing cape good hope newholland many ship bound java thereabouts keep lat find sometimes cost running ground thought great way ti hence possibly dutch call part coast land indraught magnetically drew ship fast give caution avoid rather think ti nearness land whirlpool like surprizes breadth atlantick sea good hand assured overreckoned 6 7 8 10 degree besides different draught concurrent account several experienced men •… onfirmed mr canby particularly hath sailed mate great many voyage cape lopez coast guinea barbadoes much esteem sensible man hath often told constantly found distance 60 62 degree whereas ti laid 68 69 70 72 degree common draught supposition self seaman make allowing 60 mile degree ignorant much hath canvased late year especially prevailing opinion hath 70 upwards allowed till see better ground exactness tryals made land mr norwood others considering inequality earth surface well obliquity way allowing somewhat doubtful measure upon whole matter cannot adhere general seacalculation confirmed main daily experience till certain estimate shall made hitherto attempted find self sail north south brought intended place time agreeable enough expect suppress merchant living always ashore command therefore every man pleased encourag villanies mr hurthop one captain swan merchant much importune settle resolution declare mind men last consented therefore gave warning men come aboard 13th day january 1687 earnestly expect hear captain swan would propose therefore willing go aboard unluckily two day meeting captain swan sent aboard gunner man civil carriage behaviour also accounted good artist kept journal prompted curiosity peep captain swan journal see agreed thing usual among seaman keep journal opportunity especially young men work therefore looking written journal matter sufficient accomplish end captain teat said abused captain swan laid hold opportunity revenged injury aggravated matter heighth perswading men turn captain swan commander hope commanded ship seaman easily perswaded thing quite tired long tedious voyage despaired ever getting home therefore care whither went want busied action made uneasie therefore consented teat proposed immediately aboard bound oath turn captain swan conceal design ashore ship sail would presently surgeon mate aboard ashore thought prudence go sea without surgeon therefore next morning sent ashore one john cookworthy hasten either surgeon mate pretending one men night broke leg falling hold surgeon told intended come aboard next day captain would come sent night violent tornado w lasted hour 30th day fresh land wind steered away south passing 2 shoal saw day shoal lye lat 3 south 10 league island celebes past wind died away lay decalmed till afternoon hard tornado south west towards evening saw two three spout first seen since came east indie west indie often met spout small ragged piece part cloud hanging yard seemingly blackest part thereof commonly hang sloping thence sometimes appearing small bending elbow middle never saw hang perpendicularly small lower end seeming bigger one arm ti fuller towards cloud whence proceeds surface sea begin work shall see water 100 pace circumference foam move gently round till whirling motion increase fly upward pillar 100 pace compass bottom lessening gradually upwards smallness spout self reacheth lower end spout rising seawater seems conveyed cloud visibly appears cloud increasing bulk blackness shall presently see cloud drive along although seemed without motion spout also keeping course cloud still sucking water go along make wind go thus continues space half hour le sucking spent breaking water spout pendulous piece cloud fall sea making great noise fall clashing motion sea dangerous ship spout break therefore always endeavoured shun keeping distance possibly want wind carry u away often great fear danger usually calm spout work except therefore men sea see spout coming know avoid sometimes fire shot great gun give air vent may break never hear proved benefit subject think amiss give account accident happened ship coast guinea time year 1674 one captain record london bound coast guinea ship 300 tun 16 gun called blessing came lat 7 8 degree north saw several spout one came directly towards ship wind get way spout made ready receive furling sail came swift broke little reached ship making great noise raising sea round great house thing cast sea fury wind still lasted took ship starboard bow violence snapt boltsprit foremast blew ship along ready overset ship presently right wind whirling round took ship second time like fury contrary side like overset way mizenmast felt fury second blast snapt short foremast boltsprit mainmast maintopmast received damage fury wind presently reach three men foretop foremast broke one boltsprit fell sea saved relation mr john canby quartermaster steward one ahraham wise chief mate leonard jefferies second mate usually much afraid yet damage ever heard done seem terrible enough rather come upon lie becalmd like log sea cannot get way though seen beset often yet fright always greatest harm december 1st gentle gale e e steered south noon observation lat 3 34 south saw island bouton bearing south west 10 league distant uncertain unconstant wind tornado came w u wind saint u little kinndess took advantage smallest gale got little way every day 4th day noon observation lat 4 30 south 5th day got close n w end island bouton evening fair weather hoised canoa sent moskito men 2 3 strike turtle plenty shy chose 15th day may 1688 4 clock afternoon left nicobar island directing course toward achin 8 men u company viz 3 english 4 malayan born achin mungrel portuguese vessel nicobar canoa one biggest least size much burthen one london wherry bridge built sharp end like fore part wherry deeper wherry broad thin light empty 4 men could launch hale ashore sandy bay good substantial mast mat sail good outlagers lasht fast firm side vessel made strong pole continued firm vessel could overset would easily done without made strong therefore much beholding achinese companion contrivance men none sensible danger mr hall self consided much u much scruple thing approve neither mr hall well provided left ship purposely consulted draft east indie one ship written pocketbook account bearing distance malacca coast sumatra pegu siam also brought away pocket compass direction enterprize undertake weather setting fair clear hot wind still e small breeze fanning air cloud moving gently west east gave u hope wind either west already abroad sea would short time took opportunity fair weather hope accomplish voyage achin western monsoon set strong knowing blustring weather fair weather especially first coming western monsoon rowed therefore away southward supposing clear island true wind call land hale wind often find wind sea different near shore rowed 4 oar taking turn mr hall steered also turn none rest capable rowed first afternoon night ensuing twelve league judgment course south south east 16th day morning sun hour high saw island whence came bearing n w n therefore found gone point east intended reason steered e afternoon 4 clock gentle breeze w w continued till 9 time laid oar steered away e helm found ripling sea strong current u made great noise might heard near half mile 9 clock fell calm continued till 10 wind sprung blew fresh breeze night 17th day morning lookt island sumatra supposing within 20 league rowed sailed reckoning 24 league nicobar island distance nicobar achin 40 league lookt vain island sumatra turning self saw grief nicobar island lying w n w 8 league distant visible met strong current u night wind freshned u made best use weather continued fair noon observation sun lat 6 55 mr hall 7 n 18th day wind freshned u sky began clouded indifferent clear till noon thought observation hindred cloud covered face sun came meridian often happens disappointed making observation sun clouded noon though shine clear especially place near sun obscuring sun noon commonly sudden unexpected half hour also ill presage great circle sun 5 6 time diameter seldom appears storm wind much rain ensue circle moon frequent le import commonly take great notice sun observing breach circle quarter breach thence commonly find greatest stress wind come must confess little anxious sight circle wisht heartily near land yet shewed sign discourage consort made virtue necessity put good countenance matter told mr hall wind became strong violent feared would even strong must necessity steer away wind sea till better weather presented wind instead 20 league achin driven 60 70 league coast cudda queda kingdom town harbour trade coast malacca wind therefore bearing hard rolled foot sail pole fastned settled yard within 3 foot canoa side small sail yet still big considering wind wind broad side prest much tho supported outlagers insomuch pole outlagers going side chance catch finger way lay hand crab flat ground immediately loose hold scamper away white one build wet swampy dirty ground near sea tide wash hole black crab cleanly delighting live dry place make house sandy earth black crab commonly fat full egg also accounted better meat tho sort good also great many alligator crocodile haunt island said daring west indie heard many trick followed canoa put nose gunnal jaw wide open ready devour men ashore night near sea crocodile boldly come among made run fire taken away meat therefore privateer hunting island always keep sentinel watch ravenous creature duly place fear enemy especially night fear devoured sleep spaniard cuba craules e herd hog indian mulatoes look also hunter gain livelihood killing wild hog beef island reported wet heard wind come north west commonly stormy tempestous weather attended much rain weather cold chilly october till march wind easterly e n e e e fair weather e n e wind pretty fresh wind e e small faint sometimes affording drop rain cape corientes redsea october till middle january wind variable time northerly oft shifting round compass strongest wind north often violent stormy accompanied much rain thus blow island madagascar adjacent island storm commonly preceded great sea north january till may wind n e n n e fine fresh gale sair weather may till october wind southerly july august september
